properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 2 at 8:36PM CST by NWS North Platte NE
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Nebraska...
North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and Keith
Counties.

.Minor flooding will continue along the North Platte River at Lewellen
through the end of the week. This minor flooding is due to ice
jams on the river. Fluctuations of a foot are possible with the
ice jam as ice breaks up during the day and refreezes at night.

The Flood Warning continues for
The North Platte River at Lewellen.
* until further notice.
* At  6:45 PM Thursday the stage was 8.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will remain around 8.0 feet with fluctuations
of up to one foot possible.
* Impact...At 8.0 feet...Minor flood stage. Overflow and high water
table levels may cause seepage and flooding of basements and crawl
spaces near and along the river.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive your vehicle into areas where water covers the roadway.
The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely
and the road beneath may not be intact. Vehicles caught in rising
waters should be abandoned quickly.

Do not let children play near the river during high water.
